Question
========
When testing an effect, what is the significance of a Type II error?

  
Answerlist
----------
* Falsely concluding that the effect is significant.
* Falsely concluding that there is no significant effect.
* Rightly concluding that the effect is not significant.
* Rightly concluding that the effect is significant.

Solution
========
A type II error is the assumption of $H_0$ when in reality it should have been rejected.
